intro: Hieronyma moritziana var. fendleri, commonly known as the Fendler’s hibiscus, is a species native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in rocky soils and desert environments. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystems.
